answers.answer: My first I was induced 2 days after my die date! This time around I am going to let myself go 10 days over before agreeing to be induced which will put me in labor on My birthday
I was induced start to finish took roughly 12 hours. They started me on pitocin at 7 am after breaking my water and by 635 he was here
Been induced three times. No c section.  Very fast deliveries.  No complaints what so ever. Will also be induced for this one.

My first I was induced 5days after my due date, I went in the night before and they put this thing in called cervidil that is supposed to help jump start labor I had some cramping but that was it, they said if nothing happened by 8am they would start pitocin and my water ended up breaking at 7am on it's own. Good luck and try not to work yourself up over the unknown everyone's and every time is different
My friend was induced around 8am today & at 5:30 she'd only dilated to 8...how long do they let you labor before they intervene with a c section or something?

If your water is broken by the dr. You have 12 hours to have a vaginal birth before they say you have to have a c section.  Dr broke my water at 8:30 am.  I had baby at 8:29 pm.  One minute from being forced to have a c section.  My advice... don't let them break your water.  It sucked being on a time limit to be able to have a natural birth.  I was induced at 1 am via the nurse placing half of at pill at my cervix to make it dilate.  I forget the name of it, but I had asked my doctor if I could start out with this because I hated how fierce the pitosen made my contractions for my first baby.  It worked really well and things were moving asked long great.  They were supposed to put the other half against my cervix a few hours after.  But they decided not to because I was progressing well.  Doc comes in at 8:30 and breaks my watwr.  Says you will have your baby by noon..... no. Contractions slowed.  Cervix wouldn't open anymore.  They had to give me the dreaded pitosen to get things going again.  Then I was threatened with a c section.  They should have put the other half of that pill against my cervix.  I should have refused to let her break my water.  This time I will make sure they do.  But I am always hopeful that I will go into labor naturally.  It would be nice to labor at home for a little while.
Yea my Dr is using the pill for my cervix too. I'm just nervous. I'm dilated 1 cm & I'm a huge baby when it comes to pain.

I've been threated with an induction due to my doctors convienence. But we are refusing. I've read up on it and saw all the risks, and a forced labor without medical reason is just trying to play God. The baby knows when she is ready, it's almost as if people had no idea what to do before these drugs.(Not bashing you honey if it sounds as if I am) but if you have a choice, I would think very hard on it. I would read up on it and the risks, for both you and your baby. He's going to try to induce me next week as he is a lot of couples, and there's no way. We are refusing strongly against this if there is no medical reason to put my baby and my body through that.

Lots of complications happened before these 'drugs'. I'm as much a fan of going into labor naturally if possible as anyone, but I know a man (he's eighty) who was over a month overdue. He was a twelve pound baby. That's not something I want to push out of my body, thank you very much.As long as you are able to advocate for yourself, and baby is not in distress and you aren't exhausted, and you are actually progressing, even if it's slow, you have the right to refuse a c section. But here's something you need to know: stress in labor is not helpful. If you are worried and stressed, your body will react by putting more blood flow into your arms and legs (it's called fight or flight, and it enabled our ancestors to get up and run to safety, even in the middle of labor) and less to your labor. This will slow and sometimes even stop labor, leading to the necessity of c section. So figure out some way to deal with that before you go into labor and you'll have a much better experience. Good luck!

Well who would? Being a month overdue is as much of a medical reason to be induced and put into a situation like that as preeclampsia or high blood pressure. I wasn't bashing her or anyone else for that matter. As stated above. I just gave my opinion on it and if there is something else she is able to do and does have a choice (as it is not medical related) then she should look into it and read about the risks for both her body and her baby.
I was just induced yesterday and I also was induced with my other four children and all my kids are healthy!

I got induced and I wasn't dilated at all and it went good for me it was a slow process and its like going into regular labor and also think about u will have time to plan and pack don't stress and stuff
So I'm a day past my due date & lost my mucus plug. Not really having contractions yet, just mild period like cramps & back ache. How long until labor starts?
Had two births at week early with one. They both went great. I will most likely do it again with this one.

question: Just wondering how some of you guys did with getting induced. I'm due Saturday, but we don't think she'll come on her own so I'll be getting induced on Wed. Ftm so I'm not sure what to expect. I'm super nervous about being in labor for a long time & ending up with a c section.
title: induction
